Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Peptide a (Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of PMAP-36, UCLL1c, XXE, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (65%) topeptide gK: 25%; I: 20%; V=L=G=P: 10%.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 64 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 1 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 1 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 4 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 2 uM).Toxicity: not toxic (hemo-lytic) at 32 uM.Structure: much more helical in SDS or TFE than peptide g, the further shortened one (AP3761).SAR: here helicity is correlated with peptide activity of peptides a (longer) and g (shorter).
Literature Information.Author: Biondi B, de Pascale L, Mardirossian M, Di Stasi A, Favaro M, Scocchi M, Peggion C. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of shortened derivatives of the cathelicidin PMAP-36
